data.text:
Prepare to embark on one of the most beautiful railway journeys of your life with the Kalka Shimla Toy Train. It is, indeed, an essential component of any Shimla tour with the best travel deals online. The Kalka Shimla Toy Train invites people to witness the verdant beauty of Himachal Pradesh by providing a pleasant view of the lush green valleys, rugged mountains, waterfalls, and pine-covered forests.

Introduction to Kalka-Shimla toy train

The Kalka Shimla Toy Train is one of the best ways to explore the hill station’s rich colonial history, as well as the array of fine-dining restaurants, bars, and shops lining the Mall Road and the Ridge.

The Kalka Shimla Toy Train travels 60 miles through more than 100 tunnels and 800 bridges, making it a must-see attraction for visitors of all ages. This UNESCO World Heritage Site, which was built in 1903, transports you back in time with a display of breathtaking landscapes.

The scenery you will see along the way is simply breathtaking! The best part is that the train makes you forget about the destination, giving you a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to travel with a different mindset with last minute flights availability.

Kalka Shimla Railway network:

The Kalka Shimla Toy Train is one of the greatest ways to see the hill station’s rich colonial heritage, as well as the assortment of fine-dining restaurants, pubs, and stores lining the Mall Road and the Ridge.

A brief history:

The Kalka-Shimla railway is a narrow-gauge railway in North India that runs from Kalka to Shimla over a primarily hilly route. It is well-known for its breathtaking views of the surrounding hills and villages. The railway was built between 1898 and 1903 under the guidance of Herbert Septimus Harington to connect Shimla, India’s summer capital during the British Raj, with the rest of the Indian rail system.

Sharp, Stewart, and Company built its first locomotives. The Hunslet Engine Company introduced larger locomotives. Diesel and diesel-hydraulic locomotives first entered service in 1955 and 1970, respectively.

UNESCO designated the Kalka-Shimla railway as a World Heritage Site for tourists from all around the world coming by best travel deals online on July 8, 2008.

Route

The railway runs from Kalka, approximately north of Chandigarh, to Shimla in Himachal Pradesh. The enthralling train track spans 96 kilometers (60 miles), passing through 20 railway stops, 103 tunnels, 800 bridges, and an amazing 900 turns.

The longest tunnel, which spans more than a kilometer, is located near the major railway station in Barog. From Barog to Shimla, the view is beautiful. The high grade that the train must ascend limits its speed somewhat, but it offers lots of wonderful views along the route for tourists coming by both domestic and international holiday packages. However, be prepared for a five to six-hour train trip!

Toy Train Timings from Kalka to Shimla

Kalka-Shimla Timetable

The Rail Motor Car (72451) leaves Kalka at 5:10 a.m. and arrives at 9:50 a.m. The Shivalik Deluxe Express (52451) toy train departs Kalka at 5:20 a.m. and arrives at 10 a.m.

The Himalayan Queen toy train (52455) departs from Kalka at 12:10 p.m. and arrives at 5:30 p.m.

Shimla-Kalka Timetable

The Rail Motor Car toy train (72452) leaves Shimla at 4:25 p.m. and arrives in Kalka at 9:35 p.m. The Shivalik Deluxe Express (52452) travels from Shimla at 5:50 p.m. and arrives in Kalka at 10:30 p.m. The Himalayan Queen train (52456) leaves Shimla at 10:40 a.m. and arrives in Kalka at 4:10 p.m. Tourists arriving in the city by last minute flights to India can easily access the train facilities with tourist-friendly timings.

Services for Tourist Trains:

The Kalka Shimla railway offers four regular tourist train services. These are as follows:

Shivalik Deluxe Express is a high-end express train with carpet, large glass windows, cushioned seats, soothing music, and upgraded toilets. It can carry 120 passengers. There is food provided, and the train only stops at Barog.

The Himalayan Queen is a typical train with first and second-class carriages. Food is not provided, but can be purchased at one of the nine stations along the route. Because some of the stops are only 5-10 minutes long, this train is ideal for those who want to get out and explore. A perfect paradise for photographers.

Rail Motor Car resembles a bus from the Second World War. It has a transparent roof and seats only 14 people. It’s also an express service with food. There is only one stop, at Barog. However, tickets can be difficult to obtain.

Vistadome Him Darshan Express is a new train with seven carriages that have glass roofs and modified windows to provide panoramic views. It is the only train that is air-conditioned.

How to Book Toy Train Tickets in Shimla

It is recommended that you book as soon as possible, especially during the summer months beginning in April to June. Tickets can be purchased online or at Indian Railways booking offices.

How Do I Get to Kalka?

Both Chandigarh and Delhi have several options for getting to Kalka. The three primary modes of transportation are as follows:

Air: The nearest airport to Kalka from Delhi or Chandigarh is Chandigarh Airport. So, if you’re short on time, it’s best to fly from Delhi via affordable flights to Delhi from Canada. After arriving, look for a local taxi or cab.

Train: There are several trains running from Delhi to Kalka. The most comfortable train, however, is the Shatabdi Express, which departs early in the morning. It takes nearly 4 hours to reach its destination and covers a total distance of 269 km.

To land in Kalka from Delhi or Chandigarh, accommodate a personal car or a cab. You can also travel by Volvo bus, which departs from Delhi and is usually booked in advance online.
